intro: Chassalia lurida var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chassalia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing a compact growth habit with silver-green foliage. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. This variant is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other varieties within the species.
